definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: A document from their meeting said the situation in Afghanistan is deteriorating.
sentences.chinese: 外长会议的一份文件说阿富汗的局势正在恶化。

sentences.english: At what point does the RO decide to abandon in deteriorating weather conditions?
sentences.chinese: 天气恶化时，裁判长在什么时刻决定放弃竞赛？

sentences.english: Severe cases may progress to confusion and coma.
sentences.chinese: 情况严重的会进一步恶化以致昏迷及神志不清。

sentences.english: Several factors lead to this downward spiral of the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 几大因素使得失业状况呈现螺旋形恶化。

sentences.english: If they are wearing the glasses normally prescribed for myopia, their vision will deteriorate.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们正常地配戴近视眼睛，他们的视力会恶化。

sentences.english: There were no cases of neurologic deterioration or paralysis after TES.
sentences.chinese: TES术后，没有患者出现神经功能恶化或瘫痪。

sentences.english: Deterioration in the SRS and ODI scores was of statistical significance.
sentences.chinese: SRS及ODI评分恶化有明显的统计学意义。

sentences.english: The doctor asked to be paged if the patient's condition grew  worse suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 如果病人的病情突然恶化，医生让马上用寻呼机叫他。

sentences.english: I think it does tell us that we can change how our memory improves or worsens, " Francine Grodstein of Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston, who led the study, said in a telephone interview.
sentences.chinese: 我想这些告诉了我们记忆是怎么样改善和恶化的。

sentences.english: The second answer is that the economy has deteriorated in spite of the stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 第二个回答尽管有这些刺激计划，但是经济已经恶化。

sentences.english: As the recession deepens, Barbie’s conservative values are also back in vogue.
sentences.chinese: 随经济萧条恶化，芭比娃娃的保守价值也重振雄风。

sentences.english: The company can only go to hell in a handbasket with this damned dead-cat bounce.
sentences.chinese: 该死的死猫反弹只能使该企业的所处的境地迅疾恶化。

sentences.english: And the question is to what extent the situation continues to deteriorate.
sentences.chinese: 关键问题是，形势会继续恶化到什么程度。

sentences.english: Can cyst of oral cavity mucous membrane worsen?
sentences.chinese: 口腔粘膜囊肿会不会恶化？

sentences.english: Analysts said that sentiment toward new deals in all sectors has soured in recent days.
sentences.chinese: 分析师说，近些天所有行业对于上市的态度都恶化了。

sentences.english: An overheated economy can only exacerbate an incipient deterioration in inflationary expectations.
sentences.chinese: 经济过热只会使初显恶化态势的通胀预期进一步恶化。

definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to make heavier/to emphasize/(of an illness etc) to become more serious/to aggravate (a bad situation)/to increase (a burden, punishment etc)
more critical with every passing day
to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
